preibisch_imagelib2.algorithm.gauss

Class AbstractGauss<T extends NumericType<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • preibisch_imagelib2.algorithm.gauss.AbstractGauss<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - - Defines the Type in which the actual computation is performed
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GaussDouble, GaussFloat, GaussGeneral, GaussNativeType

    public abstract class AbstractGauss<T extends NumericType<T>>
extends Object
    Author:
    Stephan Preibisch

        the result of the convolution

      • getRange

        protected Interval getRange(int dim)
        The area for the output/temp that needs to be convolved, always relative to the input of the next convolution operation. The area is larger than the input, defined by the size of the kernel in each dimension.
        Parameters:
        dim - - The dimension that is currently processed
        Returns:
        - the Interval defining the output size for the current dimension that is processed

      • createInputLineSampler

        protected SamplingLineIterator<T> createInputLineSampler(int dim,
                                                         Interval range)
        An Iterator that samples a one dimensional line of input data for the current dimension.
        Parameters:
        dim - - The current dimension
        range - - the size of the output/temp image
        Returns:
        - A SamplingLineIterator which provides the input

      • createOutputLineWriter

        protected WritableLineIterator<T> createOutputLineWriter(int dim,
                                                         Interval range,
                                                         SamplingLineIterator<T> inputLineSampler)
        An Iterator that samples a one dimensional line of output data for the current dimension.
        Parameters:
        dim - - The current dimension
        range - - the size of the output/temp image
        inputLineSampler - - the input line sampler which knows all the stuff already
        Returns:
        - A SamplingLineIterator which provides the output

      • processLine

        protected void processLine(SamplingLineIterator<T> input,
                           double[] kernel)
        Compute the current line. It is up to the implementation howto really do that. The idea is to only iterate over the input once (that's why it is an Iterator) as it is potentially an expensive operation (e.g. a Converter might be involved or we are computing on a rendered input)
        Parameters:
        input - - the Iterator/Sampler over the current input line.

      • writeLine

        protected void writeLine(WritableLineIterator<T> a,
                         SamplingLineIterator<T> inputLineSampler)
        Writes the computed line back into the output/temp image. The idea is to only iterate over the output once (that's why it is an Iterator) as it is potentially an expensive operation (e.g. a Converter might be involved)
        Parameters:
        a - - the Iterator/Sampler over the current output line.

      • updateInputLineSampler

        protected void updateInputLineSampler(SamplingLineIterator<T> a,
                                      Interval range,
                                      long[] offset,
                                      Localizable originalLocation)
        Updates the current SamplingLineIterator to the location of the new line that is processed and clears the processing line (set all values to zero)
        Parameters:
        a - - the SamplingLineIterator
        range - - the size of the output/temp image
        offset - - the new position
        originalLocation - - the location where is was put initially, all movements are relative to that

      • updateOutputLineWriter

        protected void updateOutputLineWriter(WritableLineIterator<T> a,
                                      Interval range,
                                      long[] offset,
                                      Localizable originalLocation)
        Updates the current WritableLineIterator to the location of the new line that is processed.
        Parameters:
        a - - the WritableLineIterator
        range - - the size of the output/temp image
        offset - - the new position
        originalLocation - - the location where is was put initially, all movements are relative to that
